centralQuestion: Is the job market worse than it was a generation ago?

reasons.description: Median earnings have stagnated or fallen in real terms, eroding purchasing power for most workers.

sources.title: Reuters: U.S. real earnings stalled across age, income groups in past year
Economic Policy Institute: Decline of labor unions weakens American democracy

reasons.description: Growth of gig and contract work has increased job insecurity and reduced access to benefits.

sources.title: Bloomberg News: From the Great Resignation to Lying Flat, Workers Are Opting Out
Brookings Institution: AI labor displacement and the limits of worker retraining

reasons.description: Automation and globalization have hollowed out many middle‑skill jobs, polarizing the labor market.

sources.title: McKinsey Global Institute: Jobs lost, jobs gained: What the future of work will mean for jobs, skills and wages
Brookings Institution: Generative AI, the American worker, and the future of work

reasons.description: Rising credential inflation means young entrants need more education to secure roles once open to high‑school graduates, fueling underemployment.

sources.title: Financial Times: Young Americans need to be taught skills, not handed credentials

objections.description: Unemployment remains historically low and payrolls continue to expand, indicating a robust labor market.

sources.title: Associated Press: Employers added a surprising 177,000 jobs as job market shows resilience
The Wall Street Journal: Steady Hiring Added 147,000 Jobs to U.S. Economy in June

objections.description: Wage growth at the bottom of the distribution has out‑paced historical norms, narrowing some pay gaps.

sources.title: Reuters: U.S. job gains surge past expectations, wage growth quickens
Economic Policy Institute: Strong wage growth for low-wage workers bucks the historic trend

objections.description: Remote and hybrid work have expanded geographic and schedule flexibility, boosting satisfaction and retention.

sources.title: The Guardian: 'The new normal': work from home is here to stay, US data shows
The Guardian: Hybrid working makes employees happier, healthier and more productive

objections.description: Persistent labor shortages and record job openings give workers greater bargaining power in many sectors.

sources.title: Reuters: Record-high number of U.S. small businesses can't fill job openings

research.title: The Polarization of Job Opportunities in the U.S. Labor Market: Implications for Employment and Earnings
research.description: American Economic Review P&P paper by David Autor documenting long‑run hollowing‑out of middle‑skill jobs and wage polarization.

research.title: Is the Millennial Generation Left Behind? Inter‑Cohort Labour Market Inequality 2005–2019
research.description: Social Indicators Research study using Spanish administrative data to show persistent income gaps for younger cohorts.

research.title: Generative AI at Work
research.description: Quarterly Journal of Economics (2025) article showing AI tools raise productivity, with largest gains for novice workers.

research.title: The Semi‑Proletarian Lifestyle in the Twenty‑First Century: Multiple Jobholding, Precarity, and Anti‑Work in the U.S.
research.description: Dialectical Anthropology (2024) open‑access study linking rise of side‑hustles to growing employment precarity.
